For Example: Me and a good friend of mine have practiced to perfect duo bot non meta combos mainly **full Armor runes and masteries for ADC Rammus{{champion:33}} and SUPPORT Taric{{champion:44}}**. 

To be good in bot lane they both rely on that extra armor to start off so Rammus gets damage from the armor and taric can boost his armor. 

This also applies for my Taric Jungle I use Taric's damage bonus from his bonus armor to get damage from his passive(Bravado) and his E (Dazzle) 

Not trying to be a downer about the changes, I am actually looking forward to it but the out-of-meta game styles of many players or champs may be affected 

Until then keep it cool Riot and we shall see where it takes us.

Lets summarise the current benefits of runes, and what problems may be run into without early game stats as provided by runes. 

1. Current Runes can be used to boost an early game in an unfavourable matchup,Top or Midlane. Due to lack of base resistances runes provide these so you can survive poke, or being able to at least trade effectively.
2. Current Runes are vital for some roles, eg. some junglers need armour runes to be able to survive jungle clears with relative health to be able to gank, except graves lul.
3. Current Runes are one of the biggest influences in Bottom lane, a tankier rune setup for certain tanky/engage supports allows them to take punishment and survive poke lanes etc.

Please Read this, and take into consideration what removal of base stats provided by runes will do to certain match-ups in roles; AND I can't stress enough how much impact it will make on unfavourable match-ups. Unless the new rune system can provide adequate measures against that, this is a step backward in my opinion.

I personally like these changes to runes and Masteries. Granted I believe it will take some time figuring out that some would be OP from the get go (Overheal on Rakan would make trading impossible, Bloodthirster Overheal means you have something close to a 400 Shield and Berserk would make Vayne do % max health true damage almost every second).

But, there's one thing I absolutely adore; We now have infinite Runes and Masteries. Riot doesn't add any more Runes and implementing a new Mastery means removing an old one to replace it but now with this system, they can just add it like a new champion with only having to balance it. Say they want to rework Thunderlords into the new masteries but they want it to do a small AOE thunderstorm instead of the normal single target. Done, just throw that bad boy on the PBE and then test it (and balance it for once) for the current meta. 

There is one issue that I think is going to be the most annoying is trying to find the right mastery that suits you, what your team needs and the champion you play. Example; What's the point of grabbing overheal on Darius/Illaoi when you have no allied healing? People might grab it without thinking because Darius/Illaoi only heals for missing health.

Another thing is balancing to specific champions. Jhin can just Auto attack once with Berserk and, after 3 seconds, he gets 15% bonus AD and 24% Bonus movement speed on crit. Another is the fact Perxie would make it so that say Braum, Rakan or Lee Sin jumps to a target he gives them a small shield which Perxie would Immediately return because you're right there.

In short, I like the changes but we all better be ready for the shit storm that follows with balancing issues and finding the right combination of Keystones and Runes to be the best.
